actor_awards.notes: He won the Academy Award for Best Actor for his role in 'Charly' (1968). He was personally chosen by President John F. Kennedy to portray him in 'PT 109'. He is also well known to modern audiences as Uncle Ben in the 'Spider-Man' films.

filmography.title: Charly
filmography.role_description: A mentally disabled man who undergoes a surgical procedure that triples his IQ, only to face the tragic realization that the effects are temporary.
filmography.plot: A mentally challenged bakery worker is the subject of an experiment to increase human intelligence.

filmography.title: Spider-Man
filmography.role_description: The kindly uncle of Peter Parker who delivers the iconic line 'With great power comes great responsibility' before his tragic death.
filmography.plot: When bitten by a genetically modified spider, a nerdy, shy, and awkward high school student gains spider-like abilities that he eventually must use to fight evil as a superhero after tragedy befalls his family.

filmography.title: Three Days of the Condor
filmography.role_description: A high-ranking CIA official in New York who becomes a key figure in the pursuit of a rogue analyst.
filmography.plot: A bookish CIA researcher finds all his co-workers dead, and must outwit those responsible until he figures out who he can really trust.

filmography.title: The Best Man
filmography.role_description: A ruthless and ambitious politician vying for his party's presidential nomination against a more principled rival.
filmography.plot: Two candidates struggle for their party's presidential nomination: one an intellectual ethical man, the other a man of the people but with no scruples.

filmography.title: PT 109
filmography.role_description: The young naval officer and future President who leads his crew to safety after their boat is sunk in the Pacific.
filmography.plot: The story of John F. Kennedy's World War II service as a PT boat commander in the South Pacific.

filmography.title: Picnic
filmography.role_description: The wealthy former college friend of a drifter who becomes a rival for the affection of a local beauty.
filmography.plot: A drifter falls for the girlfriend of his college buddy in a small Kansas town on Labor Day.

filmography.title: Obsession
filmography.role_description: A businessman haunted by the death of his wife and daughter who falls for a woman who looks exactly like his late wife.
filmography.plot: A man meets the exact double of his dead wife 15 years later and falls in love with her.

filmography.title: Underworld U.S.A.
filmography.role_description: A career criminal who infiltrates a crime syndicate to take revenge on the men who killed his father.
filmography.plot: A young man sets out to avenge the death of his father, who was murdered by four hoodlums.

filmography.title: The Naked and the Dead
filmography.role_description: An aide to a general who is reassigned to lead a platoon on a dangerous reconnaissance mission in the Pacific.
filmography.plot: In the Pacific during World War II, a platoon of soldiers is sent on a dangerous mission while their general tries to crush the spirit of his aide.

filmography.title: Autumn Leaves
filmography.role_description: A younger man with a troubled past who marries a lonely spinster, revealing deep psychological scars.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged typist marries a younger man, only to discover he is a pathological liar and mentally unstable.
filmography.awards: Berlin International Film Festival: Win – Silver Bear (Director)

filmography.title: Gidget
filmography.role_description: A surf bum and leader of a group of surfers who befriends the title character.
filmography.plot: A teenage girl discovers surfing and love during a summer at the beach.

filmography.title: Sunday in New York
filmography.role_description: A commercial pilot and ladies' man whose sister comes to visit him for advice on romance.
filmography.plot: A young woman visiting her brother in New York City is determined to lose her virginity but finds romance instead.

filmography.title: The Devil's Brigade
filmography.role_description: The Canadian commander who leads the elite commando unit alongside an American officer.
filmography.plot: An American colonel is assigned to train a special forces unit composed of American misfits and Canadian troops during World War II.

filmography.title: Too Late the Hero
filmography.role_description: An American Japanese language specialist who is reluctantly attached to a British commando unit.
filmography.plot: A reluctance American officer is assigned to accompany a British commando team on a mission to destroy a Japanese radio transmitter in the New Hebrides.

filmography.title: 633 Squadron
filmography.role_description: An American pilot leading a British Mosquito squadron on a daring mission against a Nazi fuel plant.
filmography.plot: A Mosquito squadron is assigned to bomb a German rocket fuel plant in Norway.

filmography.title: Battle of the Coral Sea
filmography.role_description: A submarine commander who is captured by the Japanese and must escape to deliver crucial intelligence.
filmography.plot: The crew of a U.S. submarine is captured by the Japanese and must escape from an island prison camp to reveal the location of the enemy fleet.

filmography.title: Masquerade
filmography.role_description: An American agent involved in a plot to kidnap the young heir of an Arab nation.
filmography.plot: British agents are assigned to protect the young heir to an oil-rich Middle Eastern kingdom.

filmography.title: The Honey Pot
filmography.role_description: A hired actor who assists a wealthy man in a complex charade to trick his former lovers.
filmography.plot: A wealthy man in Venice hires an actor to help him play a practical joke on three of his former lovers by pretending to be dying.

filmography.title: Midway
filmography.role_description: A fictional naval officer and pilot involved in the critical Battle of Midway.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the battle that was a turning point in the Pacific Theater of World War II.

filmography.title: Star 80
filmography.role_description: The founder of Playboy magazine, portrayed in the tragic true story of Dorothy Stratten.
filmography.plot: The true story of Playboy Playmate Dorothy Stratten, who was murdered by her estranged husband.

filmography.title: Wild Hearts Can't Be Broken
filmography.role_description: A stunt show operator who hires a runaway girl as a diving horse rider.
filmography.plot: A runaway girl becomes a diving horse rider in Atlantic City during the Great Depression.

filmography.title: Brainstorm
filmography.role_description: The CEO of the research company developing a device that can record sensory experiences.
filmography.plot: Researchers develop a device that can record the sensory experiences and emotional feelings of a subject, but it has dangerous military applications.

filmography.title: Class
filmography.role_description: The wealthy father of a prep school student whose roommate has an affair with his mother.
filmography.plot: A young man has an affair with an older woman, only to find out she is his roommate's mother.

filmography.title: J.W. Coop
filmography.role_description: An aging rodeo cowboy released from prison who tries to make a comeback. Robertson also directed.
filmography.plot: After losing 10 years to prison, a cowboy tries to adjust to the modern rodeo circuit.

filmography.title: Man on a Swing
filmography.role_description: A police chief investigating a murder who is aided by a mysterious clairvoyant.
filmography.plot: A police chief investigating a murder receives help from a clairvoyant whose visions are disturbingly accurate.

filmography.title: Escape from L.A.
filmography.role_description: The ultra-conservative President of the United States who banishes his own daughter to the island of L.A.
filmography.plot: Snake Plissken is once again called in by the United States government to recover a potential doomsday device from Los Angeles, now an autonomous island where undesirables are deported.

filmography.title: Renaissance Man
filmography.role_description: The commanding officer at the base where Danny DeVito's character teaches.
filmography.plot: A failed businessman is hired by the army to teach a group of underachieving recruits.

filmography.title: The Pilot
filmography.role_description: An airline pilot who struggles to hide his alcoholism while flying commercial jets. Robertson also directed.
filmography.plot: A commercial airline pilot fights his addiction to alcohol while trying to maintain his career and reputation.
